attributes.comment:
This is in response to USCIS-2006-0044.

I am in the process of applying for my peramnent residency. I have waited six (6)
years for the first sign that my request is in process. It will still take me at least
six years more to become a US citizen. And I mean no disrespect: All the fees
are paid in full and up front. The service is slow, non transparent, and expensive as
it is. I see myself spending so much time and resources applying for documents
and paperwork, Fed-Ex-ing documents all over the place, and noone is regarding
the added cost. And here is the biggest impact: The cost of fuel has put families in
a position that they are re-considering flying to visit their families, effectively
choaking the aviation indistry. If the cost of advnace parole is now going to be
$500 per person per year, people are going to either not fly or eventually leave
alltogether, depleating the US of it's capable workforce and willing LEGAL
immigrants. Small changes now are going to result in large problems in the future.
Thanks.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Don Foris
